questions.text: A 70-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to sudden-onset weakness in his right arm and leg. Although he can speak, he cannot pronounce words clearly. Neurologic examination shows 3/5 strength in both right upper and lower extremities. When the patient is asked to stick out his tongue, it deviates to the left. Sensory examination shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely vessel affected that explains this patient's brain injury?

An experiment is being conducted on a dog blood pressure to study the effect of acetylcholine. The blood pressure is recorded at each intervention and is shown below. What does phase 4 in the graph indicate?

Identify the true statements: Rectal temperature is better for measuring the core body temperature and is higher than axillary and oral temperature readings. Hypocalcemia, hyperkalemia, hypomagnesemia are complications of massive blood transfusion Aortic regurgitation murmur is noted during isovolumetric contraction Dyspnea on using the washroom is NYHA grade 3

A 40-year-old female came with complaints of chest pain, palpitation and shortness of breath. On auscultation, a mid-diastolic murmur was heard and on examination, a prominent ’a’ wave on JVP was found. What is the most appropriate diagnosis among the following options?

37-year-old woman is evaluated for progressive shortness of breath and dry cough. The patient has seasonal allergies and takes no medications. Chest imaging studies reveal pulmonary infiltrates and hilar adenopathy. The patient undergoes lung biopsy; the findings are shown below. Which of the following sets of immune cells and cytokines is most likely responsible for the development of this patient's pathologic findings?
Which of the following is the correct sequence of cellular events of acute inflammation?

options.label: A
options.text: Rolling----Stable adhesion---Activation of integrins----Migration via endothelium

options.label: B
options.text: Rolling----Activation of Integrins----Stable Adhesion----Migration via endothelium

options.label: C
options.text: Stable adhesion---Rolling----Activation of integrins----Migration via endothelium

options.label: D
options.text: Activation of integrins----Migration via endothelium---Stable adhesion---Rolling

questions.correct_answer: B. Rolling----Activation of Integrins----Stable Adhesion----Migration via endothelium
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Rolling----Activation of Integrins----Stable Adhesion----Migration via endothelium

questions.text: A young boy with a history of multiple blood transfusions presents with bone pain for the past 6 months. A peripheral smear showed sickle-shaped RBCs. Which of the following drugs are not used in the treatment of his condition?

A 4-week-old, full-term boy is brought to the emergency department due to vomiting. His parents describe the emesis as undigested formula without blood or bile. The vomiting occurs after feeds and has increased in frequency and force over the past 3 days. Examination shows a sunken anterior fontanelle and dry mucous membranes. Arterial blood gas analysis is most likely to reveal which of the following sets of values?

options.label: A
options.text: pH 7.29, PaCo2 30, HCO3 14, Anion gap Elevated

options.label: B
options.text: pH 7.30, PaCo2 50, HCO3 28, Anion gap normal

options.label: C
options.text: pH 7.48, PaCo2 46, HCO3 34, Anion gap normal

options.label: D
options.text: pH 7.53, PaCo2 22, HCO3 22, Anion gap normal

questions.correct_answer: C. pH 7.48, PaCo2 46, HCO3 34, Anion gap normal
questions.explanation: Ans. C) pH 7.48, PaCo2 46, HCO3 34, Anion gap normal

questions.text: All of the following are true: Blood transfusion requires screening of donor blood for HIV, HCV, HBV but not dengue. Radioactive iodine is the treatment of choice for Graves ophthalmopathy. Raised 2,3 BPG, Acidosis, HbF cause a right shift of the oxygen-hemoglobin dissociation curve Macula densa is located at the Junction of thick ascending limb and DCT The organ with the least arteriovenous pressure difference is the kidney. Hemineglect can be localized to right parietal lobe

Patient presents with severe restlessness, tremors to the emergency department. She has a history of bronchial asthma. On examination, a swollen neck is observed. Blood pressure and heart rate are elevated. ECG shows atrial fibrillation. Which of the following drugs can be given in this case?

A 66-year-old man comes to the office due to increasing shortness of breath over the past 3 weeks. He has had a nonproductive cough for several months, which he attributes to allergies, but also notes a 9-kg unintentional weight loss over this time. He has a 50-pack-year smoking history. Chest x-ray is shown below. Which of the following would be the expected physical examination finding over the right lower chest?

A patient presents with sensory loss and weakness of limbs for 3 months. He has angular stomatitis. On examination, there is loss of proprioception, vibration sensations, UMN type of lower limb weakness, absent ankle reflex. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Subacute combined degeneration of cord
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Subacute combined degeneration of cord

questions.text: Which of the following conditions is associated with Hypokalemic metabolic alkalosis with hypertension?
All the following are signs of amitriptyline toxicity except:

56-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to chest palpitations The patient feels that his heartbeat is fast and irregular. The patient normally drinks only 2-3 times a year, but he hosted a party last night for his wife's birthday and consumed a large amount of alcohol. Pulse check confirms the presence of an iZrregularly irregular rhythm with a rate of 138/min. This patient's ECG strip is most likely to show which of the following?
A 16-year-old patient was brought to emergency with seizures, fever, headache, confusion. MRI is shown. What is the most likely diagnosis?

An elderly male went for a medical examination. Laboratory investigations showed a marked elevation of lymphocytes with marked leukocytosis. The peripheral smear of the patient is given below. What is the appropriate next step for this patient?

42-year-old man is hospitalized with fever and persistent sore throat. On physical examination, his temperature is 38.3 C (101 F), blood pressure is 120/80 mm Hg, pulse is 94/min, and respirations are 16/min. There are several bruises on his trunk, and blood is oozing from his intravenous catheter venipuncture sites. His blood fibrinogen level is 110 mg/dL (normal 150-400 mg/dL). Bone marrow biopsy is shown here. Chromosomal analysis of these immature cells is most likely to show which of the following abnormalities?

Identify the true statements: Aminophylline acts as an adenosine receptor antagonist leading to diuresis Filgrastim is the drug of choice for chemotherapy induced thrombocytopenia Cephalosporins that do not require dose adjustment in renal failure because they are secreted in bile are ceftriaxone and cefoperazone. Denosumab can decrease bone resorption as well as increase bone formation
Which of the following drugs reversibly binds the site A?

A 35-year-old previously healthy man has noticed blood in his urine for the past 2 days Laboratory findings show a serum urea nitrogen level of 45 mg/dL and creatinine level of 3.1 mg/dL. A renal biopsy specimen is obtained; the immunofluorescence pattern of staining with antibody against human IgG is shown in the figure. Which of the following serologic findings is most likely to be present in this patient?

66-year-old man with hypertension and stage IV chronic kidney disease comes to the OPD for follow-up. Laboratory results show normocytic, normochromic anemia with a low reticulocyte count. Serum iron studies are within normal limits. Treatment with a recombinant glycoprotein hormone is begun and repeat laboratory testing several weeks later shows an improvement in hemoglobin level. The effects of the hormone prescribed for this patient are most likely mediated by which of the following pathways?

options.label: C
options.text: Janus kinase 2/signal transducers and activators of transcription

questions.correct_answer: C. Janus kinase 2/signal transducers and activators of transcription
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Janus kinase 2/signal transducers and activators of transcription

questions.text: 62-year-old man is hospitalized with severe abdominal pain and diarrhea after a recent urinary tract infection. Endoscopy is shown below. The patient is placed on an oral macrocyclic antibiotic that inhibits the sigma subunit of RNA polymerase. Which of the following agents was most likely administered to this patient?

Identify the true statements: TxA2 has platelet aggregating and vasoconstricting effect Lipoxin B4 inhibits neutrophil chemotaxis and adhesion to endothelium. Il-1, Il-6, TNF are pyrogenic cytokines C3 can be activated is both common as well as alternative pathways MCL1, BCL-2, BCL-XL and PUMA are anti-apoptotic factors.

Special electrodes are used to detect the change in membrane potential of a specific type of cardiac cell. These changes are recorded on the graph below. The deflection indicated by the arrow is most likely caused by movement of which of the following ions?
A patient was brought to the hospital after a road traffic accident. He had severe muscle injury. ECG is shown here. What change will happen to the resting membrane potential in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: First becomes more positive, then negative

questions.text: All of the following are correct about definition of postural hypotension except:

options.label: A
options.text: Fall of at least 20 mmHg in systolic blood pressure

options.label: B
options.text: Fall of at least 10 mmHg in diastolic BP

options.label: D
options.text: Occurs on head-up tilt table testing (HUTT) at an angle of at least 60˚

questions.correct_answer: C. Within 10 min of active standing
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Within 10 min of active standing

questions.text: A 32-year-old man is being evaluated due to several weeks of watery diarrhea. He has also had intermittent, crampy abdominal pain and has lost 7 kg during this period. The patient has a history of HIV and was hospitalized 6 months ago for Pneumocystis pneumonia. Stool tests for leukocytes and occult blood are negative. Endoscopy is performed, and mucosal biopsy is shown. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

64-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department due to confusion and lethargy. The patient was asymptomatic when her husband left for work in the morning, but when he arrived home, he found her in bed weak and disoriented. The patient's medical conditions include type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension, for which she takes multiple medications. Laboratory testing shows an elevated serum C-peptide level. If her current condition is due to an antidiabetic drug, which of the following is the most likely culprit agent?
An 11-year-old child diagnosed with acute rheumatic fever and having no valvular pathology comes to your clinic. What is the duration of prophylaxis given to this child?

38-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to jaundice, nausea, and abdominal discomfort. Scleral icterus and hepatomegaly are present. Laboratory results are as follows: Total bilirubin: 4.7 mg/dL Alkaline phosphatase: 110 U/L Aspartate aminotransferase (SGOT): 791 U/L Alanine aminotransferase (SGPT): 634 U/L Anti-smooth muscle antibody titers are elevated. Which of the following histologic findings is most likely to be seen on biopsy of this patient's liver?

options.label: C
options.text: Lymphoplasmacytic infiltration of portal and periportal regions

options.label: D
options.text: Periductal fibrosis and luminal obliteration of biliary ducts

questions.correct_answer: C. Lymphoplasmacytic infiltration of portal and periportal regions
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Lymphoplasmacytic infiltration of portal and periportal regions

questions.text: Reflex responsible for tachycardia during right atrial distension?
What characteristics define necrosis among the options provided? Disrupted cell membrane Induces inflammation Swelling of the cell Can be seen physiologically
Identify the wrongly matched pair of antifungals with its mechanism of action?

options.label: B
options.text: Flucytosine: Inhibits microtubule synthesis and thus hinders mitosis

questions.correct_answer: B. Flucytosine: Inhibits microtubule synthesis and thus hinders mitosis
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Flucytosine: Inhibits microtubule synthesis and thus hinders mitosis

questions.text: Which of the following regions contain only thick filaments and no thin filaments?
Which of the following statements is true about blood products?

options.label: A
options.text: Platelets is stored between 20°C to 24°C with a shelf life of 5 days

options.label: B
options.text: Cryoprecipitate is stored at -20°C with a shelf life of 6 months

options.label: C
options.text: Packed red cells stored with adenine, glucose, mannitol and saline is stored between -5°C to -15 °C with a shelf life of 5 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Fresh frozen plasma is stored between -5°C to -15° C with a shelf life of 2 years

questions.correct_answer: A. Platelets is stored between 20°C to 24°C with a shelf life of 5 days
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Platelets is stored between 20°C to 24°C with a shelf life of 5 days

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding Mendelian mode of inheritance?

options.label: A
options.text: Every 10th patient has a Y-linked disorder

options.label: B
options.text: 1/3rd of Mendelian disorders is autosomal recessive

options.label: C
options.text: Every 5th patient has an X-linked recessive disorder

options.label: D
options.text: 2/3rds (66%) of Mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant

questions.correct_answer: D. 2/3rds (66%) of Mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant
questions.explanation: Ans. D) 2/3rds (66%) of Mendelian disorders are autosomal dominant

questions.text: A chronic smoker was on nicotine replacement therapy and clonidine tablets for smoking de-addiction. He stopped taking clonidine tablets and now presents with a headache. What is the reason behind this condition?
Identify the correctly matched pair of substances with their renal clearance from the graph given below?

options.label: A
options.text: A - Glucose, B - PAH, C - Bicarbonate and D - Inulin

options.label: B
options.text: A - Glucose, B - Bicarbonate, C - Inulin and D - PAH

options.label: C
options.text: A - PAH, B - Inulin, C - Glucose and D - Bicarbonate

options.label: D
options.text: A - Inulin, B - Glucose, C - Bicarbonate and D – PAH

questions.correct_answer: B. A - Glucose, B - Bicarbonate, C - Inulin and D - PAH
questions.explanation: Ans. B) A - Glucose, B - Bicarbonate, C - Inulin and D - PAH

questions.text: A patient met with a road traffic accident and developed a cervical spine injury. The fracture fragment had pierced the lateral aspect of the dorsal column tract. Which of the following findings is seen in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Absence of ipsilateral lower limb proprioception

options.label: B
options.text: Absence of fine motor movement of fingers

options.label: D
options.text: Absence of contralateral lower limb proprioception

questions.correct_answer: C. Absence of ipsilateral arm proprioception
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Absence of ipsilateral arm proprioception
